title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: is a suburb of Glasgow, it consists of many districts pndsmall burghs on both sides of the Clyde, thus Partick,Whiteinch, Hillhead, Kelvinside on the north; Govanhill,Pollockshields, Crosshill, Ibrox, and Tradeston on the south,with these latter may be included Hutchestown, Gorbals, andLaurieston. It was part of the Cathedral jurisdiction ofGlasgow, and has a long church history, for the Church ofGovan was for centuries supplied with ministers, elected bythe governing body of the University of Glasgow, and thusthe most notable of Scottish Divines administered to theneeds of the people, who worshipped in the parish church.
